hero_sub: Full-Stack Developer & Fashion Designer. UI/UX, performance, and accessibility.
about_text: I started my career in fashion design, where I learned to turn ideas into real, usable products. Over time, I became passionate about digital experiences, research, and problem-solving, which led me to transition into tech as a UX/UI Designer with a full-stack development foundation. Today, I work at the intersection of creativity, research, and technology, designing solutions that are meaningful, functional, and grounded in user insights.
about_linkedin_intro: You can learn more about my work and experience on LinkedIn.
skills_list: HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, Java, Spring Boot, React, Tailwind, Adobe Suite, SQL, Git/GitHub...
modal_extra_education_intro: Here are some additional workshops, certifications, and courses that strengthened my skills in both tech and design.
modal_skills_text: Here are some of the technologies and tools I have experience with:
modal_about_education_intro: Here’s a glimpse of my academic background and learning path:
modal_about_fullstack: Java Full Stack Developer Jr - Generation Mexico
modal_about_fullstack_desc: Generation Mexico – Java Full Stack Bootcamp (2025). Learned end-to-end web development with Spring Boot, Java, MySQL, AWS deployment and more.
modal_about_fashiondesign_desc: Associate Degree in Fashion Design. Developed a strong eye for detail, aesthetics, proportion, and user-centric creation that now enhances UI/UX work.
modal_problem_1: Configuring AWS Elastic Beanstalk was challenging due to environment variable errors.
modal_problem_2: JWT authentication caused CORS issues in production; fixed by adjusting backend headers.
modal_problem_3: We synchronized local and deployed databases using migration scripts with MySQL Workbench.
modal_story_1: As a user, I want to buy creative materials to practice what I learn in the courses.
modal_story_2: As a member, I want to participate in the community forum to exchange tips and feedback with others.
modal_story_3: As a student, I want to learn at my own pace with flexible access to classes and resources.
modal_role_1: Frontend Developer – Responsible for UI design and responsive layout using Bootstrap.
modal_role_2: Backend Developer – Implemented API routes, database models, and authentication with Spring Boot.
modal_role_3: Project Coordinator – Managed Git branches, documentation, and team communication.
modal_fit_problem_1: Designing a responsive UI that adapts to both mobile and desktop screens.
modal_fit_problem_2: Handling user input validation for numeric macro calculations.
modal_fit_problem_3: Syncing tracker states across multiple components using React hooks.
modal_fit_story_1: As a user, I want to track my macros and calories to stay consistent with my diet goals.
modal_fit_story_2: As a fitness enthusiast, I want to create a shopping list based on my daily meal plan.
modal_fit_story_3: As a curious learner, I want to stay informed through blog articles about nutrition, supplements, and training.
modal_fit_future_1: Integration with wearable devices such as Apple Watch or Whoop for real-time tracking.
modal_fit_future_2: Weekly progress charts for calories, macros, and weight evolution.
modal_fit_future_3: Personalized notifications and reminders for hydration, training, and meal timing.
aprendeshop_description: AprendeShop is a full-stack web application developed as part of Generation’s Java Full-Stack Bootcamp.
aprendeshop_tasks_title: As part of the team, I collaborated on:
aprendeshop_task_1: Developing responsive UI components with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Bootstrap
aprendeshop_task_2: Building backend functionality with Java and Spring Boot
aprendeshop_task_3: Implementing RESTful APIs with Spring Boot JPA/Hibernate
aprendeshop_task_4: Securing authentication and authorization with Spring Security, JWT, and BCrypt
aprendeshop_task_5: Designing and maintaining relational schemas with MySQL/MariaDB
aprendeshop_conclusion: Although AprendeShop is not a commercial product, it demonstrates my ability to work in agile teams and build scalable solutions.
jsdemo_description:
A simple JavaScript demo project: a user search app.
Built with Vanilla JS, HTML5, and CSS3. Fetch user data asynchronously from a REST API.
fitapp_description: Macro Calculator, Food Tracker, Shopping List, Fitness Blog and more..
fitapp_text: This app is inspired by the bodybuilding lifestyle where nutrition is everything. - I’m currently building this demo.
improve_description: Improvements based on user stories, applying Universal Design principles and user-centered approach to optimize the Birdman site experience. The redesign aims for clearer navigation, visually harmonious and inclusive. I’m currently iterating the project to refine interaction, accessibility, and overall visual coherence.
modal_birdman_story_1: As a user, I want to easily browse the products and distinguish each protein visually.
modal_birdman_story_2: As a visitor, I want the color palette and visuals to reflect each bird’s essence, strengthening brand recall.
modal_birdman_story_3: As a user with different devices, I need an accessible, responsive, and visually coherent interface.
odoo_description: Web mockup built with Bootstrap, SCSS, and a focus on desktop viewports (≥992px). It was created as part of a technical interview assessment to demonstrate skills in modern layout development, SCSS variable management, project organization best practices and using figma AI.
google_text: This certificate allows me to work with complete UX processes: user research, problem definition, ideation, wireframes, prototyping, usability testing, and advanced UI design. It integrates Figma, accessibility and industry best practices.
google_courses: Empathize, Define, Ideate: User, Empathy map, Persona, User Journey, Statements, Flows, Storyboard, Sitemaps, IA..
Conduct UX Research and Test Early Concepts
Create High-Fidelity Designs and Prototypes in Figma
Build Dynamic User Interface (UI) for Websites
Design a User Experience for Social Good & Prepare for Jobs
mapping_description: This case study documents the mapping process behind the redesign of a minimal, modern e-commerce experience. Using Figma, the core elements of the user journey to identify friction points, clarify decision paths, and improve the flow from browsing to checkout.
mapping_conclution: Each section highlights a different layer of the experience from user actions and emotions, to frontstage interactions, backstage processes, and design opportunities. Understanding how users move through an experience and how to redesign a flow with clarity and intention. This structured supports better decisions, clearer navigation, and a more intuitive shopping experience overall.
figma_text: Find my latest UI mockups on Figma — they’re still a work in progress, but constantly evolving with new layouts and design explorations.
SQL_description: This repository contains my SQL practice exercises during the bootcamp. It includes examples of:
SQL_task_3: Basic queries (SELECT, WHERE, ORDER BY, DISTINCT)
aprendeshop_detail_subtitle: Full stack web · Educational e-commerce built with Java, Spring Boot and Bootstrap.
project_overview_text: AprendeShop is a full-stack academic project (It’s not a real client case, but it’s designed as if it were). An educational e-commerce platform developed by a multidisciplinary team under the Agile Scrum methodology. The goal was to design and build a functional MVP, it simulates a real client scenario with user authentication, explore courses, manage wishlists, and participate in a community forum, applying user-centered design. We worked in weekly sprints including planning, reviews, and retrospectives.
technologies_list: Frontend: HTML, CSS and JavaScript using Bootstrap 5.3.7. Backend: Java, Spring Boot and MySQL. Additional tools: Figma (UX/UI design), Trello, GitHub (version control), AWS (deployment) and JSON (dynamic data handling)
features_list: User registration and role-based authentication with JSON Web Token.  Wishlist for courses. Discussion forum for community interaction. Dynamic rendering of courses and categories via JSON. Deployed using GitHub Pages and AWS
based_on_text: This project was developed as part of Generation Mexico’s Full-Stack Java Bootcamp, combining educational accessibility with e-commerce functionality in a real collaborative environment. Each sprint focused on delivering usable increments — from database modeling to interface validation — ensuring design and development decisions aligned with user needs and business goals.
ux_empathize_desc: Study the market, analyze competitors, understand business and client needs to define goals and parameters.
ux_define_desc: Clarify the main problem — Optional access to the materials along each course and ensuring user guidance through the community forum.
ux_ideate_desc: Collaborative teamwork - brainstorming, empathy reviews, and decision-making to generate user-centered ideas.
ux_prototype_desc: Build a high-fidelity prototype in Figma that visualizes the user experience and interaction flow.
ux_test_desc: Validate with usability testing and technical implementation checks using Postman and MySQL, iterating based on feedback.
my_role_text: Full-Stack Developer, my main focus was UX/UI design, frontend structure, and maintaining visual consistency in the design system to ensure an intuitive, aesthetic, and responsive user experience. Collaborating closely with backend integration and using Git branches and Pull Requests for team coordination.
tech_json: Dynamic data handling with JSON for rendering courses and categories.
tech_emails: Automatic email sent to the team from the Contact form using EmailJS.
tech_front: Frontend built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript using Bootstrap 5.3.7.
tech_back: Backend implemented in Java 21 with Spring Boot Gradle, JPA/Hibernate and connection with MySQL database.
tech_test: Implemented postman with methods GET, POST, PUT and DELETE also Junit5
tech_deploy_git: Deployed via GitHub Pages with version control in Git.
problem_solving_text: Integrated a cohesive design system across front and back. Structured reusable dynamic rendering logic using JSON. Improved productivity by applying Scrum ceremonies and Trello task management. Balanced visual design with technical scalability, ensuring maintainability and cross-browser compatibility.
